We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 14:56 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers cut away a fault on the underground network in the Joseph Powell Close area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 3 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent at 14:18 by Simon - More electricity has been diverted thanks to our ground team's continued work, restoring power to further properties.

We know that some properties are still without electricity. If this is the case at your property, don't worry; I'll still keep you informed.

If your electricity has come back on now, or does so at any time in the future, simply click this link to stop receiving our SMS updates: bit.ly/348KOZ3.

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

If you haven't already, please layer up in warm clothes or blankets and avoid opening doors and windows. It is also advised to stay in the same room where possible with the door closed to retain the heat.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on asap.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Simon from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are continuing with the repairs to the underground cable fault.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Simon at 16:54.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 01:04 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Duke Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 00:17 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that that the repair work is proving to be more complex than previously anticipated and as a result, we may need to turn off more power to enable safe repairs. Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 01:00-02:00 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Is your power back on? We keep texting those signed up, and will continue to until the final 36 customers are restored. Want to stop receiving text updates? You will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you.

Sent by Lisa at 23:41 - Thanks for bearing with us over tonight. Our team of cable jointers have identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, Lisa here - I just wanted to introduce myself, and let you know that I'll be here through the night to keep you updated with news from our staff as they work to get your lights back on.

In order to provide you the clearest information, my team and I write our updates in real time. Because of this, I apologise in advance if I make any mistakes with spelling or grammar; we're only human!

I know that it's dark and that will be especially worrying, but both our field teams and our contact centre work 24 hours a day, so for now, I hope you're doing okay and I'll let you know as soon as we have some more news.

I know that it's dark and that will be especially worrying, but both our field teams and our contact centre work 24 hours a day, so for now, I hope you're doing okay and I'll let you know as soon as we have some more news.

Sent by Lisa at 22:43 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers carry out repairs on the underground network in the Wear Bay Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

Our customer support vehicle is now on site. It's located outside 48 King Edward Road and is ready to provide extra support to anyone affected by the power cut.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Kevin at 09:27.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Wykeham Street area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 18-JAN-2026 14:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Reach Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Kevin at 11:45.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 11:24 - Our staff are on the way to the Reach Road area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 16:00 and 17:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message: Sent by Kevin at 12:20 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 761 properties still affected by the overhead network fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 792 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Kevin from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working/ to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Tonbridge TN11 area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 630 customers. There are now 923 properties still affected. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Kevin at 11:51.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 11:19 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is on our overhead network affecting 1553 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 14:00 and 15:00. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 11:05. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Sent by David at 12:46 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Churchmead Road area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 16:00 and 17:00, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.
